ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English to-night, equivalent to to- + night, meaning 'on this night'.

MEANINGS.PATTERN: [adv] today in the evening or night
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: On the current evening or night; during the night following the present day.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在今晚；在今天晚上的这段时间里。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I have plans to go out to dinner tonight.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我计划今晚出去吃晚餐。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: [n] the night of the present day
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a person, place, thing, or idea
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Tonight will be cold, so dress warmly.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 今晚会很冷，所以要穿暖和。
